- Collaborate with the PE and QA departments to develop automation projects aimed at building a smart factory.

- University & above graduated

- Good chance to be trained on the job and various training courses by the company and Panasonic Group
- Career development opportunity by job rotation and internal recruiting program

Title: Golang Engineer | Global E-Commerce SaaS | High Growth
Company: Channelwill
Location: 29A Nguyen Dinh Chieu, Da Kao Ward, District 1
Job Description:
About Us
Channelwill is a US-headquartered, tech-driven SaaS company with 11 years of experience in global e-commerce infrastructure. We hold 10 core invention patents and process over 5 million orders daily, empowering 300,000+ enterprise clients including SHEIN, Aliexpress, and DJI, with cumulative GMV in the hundreds of billions. As a fast-growing near-unicorn, we are building intelligent SaaS solutions to lower the barriers of global brand-building, enabling entrepreneurs worldwide to sell successfully across borders.


Responsibilities
Refactor and optimize core modules
Participate in feature iterations and daily development tasks

Technical Skills
Proficiency with frameworks such as Gin, go-zero
Experience with MySQL 8, Redis, RabbitMQ, and service discovery middleware
Familiar with Go libraries (gin, viper, cobra, zap, testify, nacos) and ORM frameworks (gorm/xorm)
Hands-on experience with microservices, gRPC, and frameworks like go-micro, Kratos, Kitex
Proficiency in Linux and Docker, with knowledge of containerization and Kubernetes
Strong understanding of network programming (TCP/HTTP protocols)
(Nice to Have: experience in high-concurrency or big data systems, open-source contributions, Shopify/overseas e-commerce platform experience, AWS/GCP familiarity)




Why Join Us
Join a high-growth, compounding SaaS industry
Be part of the founding team of our Vietnam R&D center, building from 0 → 1
Work on high-concurrency, large-scale data challenges
Collaborate and learn with senior Golang evangelists, e.g. daheige （https://github.com/daheige）




Our Strengths
Strong technical barriers: 10 patents, systems handling tens of millions of orders
Solid customer base: 300,000+ enterprises including global leaders
Quality growth: 60%+ CAGR for 5 consecutive years, profitable
Market potential: Top 3 SaaS provider in global independent e-commerce


Founder’s Message

“We started with logistics tracking SaaS and grew into an infrastructure provider handling tens of millions of orders daily. Now, as we set up our second R&D center in Vietnam
, we’re looking for talented engineers with product mindset and ambition to build a $10B SaaS company together.”

— Broc (Founder)
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer Science or related field
2+ years of backend development experience in Golang
Solid technical foundation, good understanding of system mechanisms and principles
Strong logical thinking, ownership mindset, collaboration and communication skills, high self-motivation, and eagerness to learn
Language Proficiency: Fluent in  Mandarin OR English for effective communication and cross-cultural collaboration.

- Lead the HRBP team (3 - 5 members) to ensure effective partnership with business units in implementing HR strategies.
- Manage and develop the HRBP team to ensure the delivery of professional, effective, and aligned HR services that support the company’s strategic direction.
- Collaborate with specialized HR functions (Recruitment, L&D, C&B, Employee Relations, etc.) to provide comprehensive and high-quality HR solutions to business units.
- Communicate and implement HR strategies and policies in line with the CHRO’s direction and the company’s business goals.
- Advise business leaders on people-related matters, identify human capital risks, and propose effective mitigation strategies.
- Oversee HRBP operations to ensure efficient internal coordination, compliance, and continuous improvement in delivering value-added HR services.

REASONS TO JOIN SHBFINANCE:
- Professional, open working environment
- Working hours from Monday to Friday, lunch break 1h30' (40h/week)
- Friendly, open colleagues with a mindset that promotes the development of each individual;
- Office with open, spacious space, fully equipped to serve the work.
Special attention to employees:
- Competitive compensation package with periodic salary increase policy. Average total income 14 months salary/year;
- Lunch support up to 1,200,000 VND/month; Parking support 200,000 VND/month
- Birthday leave with salary + birthday gift
- Exclusive health care benefits SHBFC Care comprehensive health insurance;
- Annual health check-up at Vietnam's leading hospital;
- Annual travel, annual team building activities.
- Focus on supporting personal development:
- Get advice, support and career development support from talented and experienced managers;

- Policies to support learning activities, improve foreign language proficiency, exchange, share knowledge, cultural exchange (Training, Seminar...)

- Education: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Human Resources, Business Administration, Economics, or a related field.
- Experience: Minimum of 7 years of experience in Human Resources, with at least 3 years in a managerial role overseeing Talent Acquisition and HRBP functions. Prior experience in financial services, banking, insurance, securities or large-scale, fast-paced organizations is highly preferred.
- Professional Competencies:
+Proven ability to develop strategies, manage planning, and oversee the performance of both Talent Acquisition and HRBP teams.
+ Strong knowledge across core HR areas: recruitment, organizational development, performance management, compensation & benefits, employee relations, and corporate culture.
+ Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret HR data and make informed decisions.

- Language Proficiency: Fluent in English (listening, speaking, reading, and writing), with the ability to operate effectively in a professional, bilingual environment and report to senior leadership.
- Personal Attributes:
+Proactive, adaptable, results-oriented, and innovation-driven.

Title: Junior English-Speaking Accountant & Legal Admin
Company: Ad - One Vietnam
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Level 72, Landmark 81, Vinhomes Central Park, 720A Dien Bien Phu Street, Ward 22, Binh Thanh District, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
Job Title: Remote Accounting & Legal Admin (English Speaking)
Location: Remote (Vietnam)
Salary: 15,000,000 to 18,000,000 VND, based on experience
About Us:

[JB Heating Services] is a well-established heating and plumbing company, founded in 1997. We provide services across Lancashire and Manchester, specializing in boiler repairs, servicing, and installations. To support our growing business, we are creating a dedicated Accounting & Legal Department to manage our financials, profit tracking, engineer bonuses, and other administrative responsibilities.

Job Overview:

As a Remote Accounting & Legal Admin, you will be responsible for managing financial records, ensuring accuracy in invoices, tracking engineer bonuses and timesheets, handling supplier invoices, and overseeing company payments. You will also coordinate with other departments such as Customer Service and Logistics to ensure smooth operations. This role requires excellent attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to work independently while communicating fluently in English.

Key Responsibilities:

• Bookkeeping: Save and manage invoices in Bookkeeping Software, ensuring accurate records.
• Bank Account Management: Oversee money in-and-out of business bank accounts, ensuring all transactions are properly documented with invoices.
• Payment Tracking: Ensure all payments are recorded in Commusoft, coordinating with the Customer Service team.
• Credit for Parts (CFP): Manage returned parts and chase credits from suppliers, working with the Customer Service and Logistics teams.
• Supplier Invoices: Verify supplier charges, deduct incorrect charges from engineers’ wages, or list them as business expenses.
• Profit Sheet Management: Track all created invoices and business expenses, ensuring they are added to the General Profit Sheet (GPS).
• Invoice Verification: Check invoices created by the Logistics Admins from the previous day.
• Engineer Messaging: Review messages and emails from engineers to ensure all reimbursements or deductions are applied correctly.
• Credit Notes: Create credit notes once approved by JB.
• Timesheet Management: Track timesheets for all UK employees.
• Outstanding Invoices: Coordinate with the Customer Service team to follow up on outstanding payments.
• Payment Management: Handle payments for suppliers, insurance, work equipment, refunds, and other expenses.
• Quotes: Assist JB with generating quotes.
• Work Equipment Management: Oversee van, uniform, and boiler sticker management in coordination with UK Admin and Logistics Admins.
• RAM Tracking: Manage vehicle-related information, including tax, MOT, and insurance.
• Training Courses: Administer training courses for employees.
• Careplan and Smart Debits: Manage the company’s care plans and smart debits.
• Additional Administrative Tasks: Assist with accounting paperwork and other related tasks.
• Gather evidence for small money claims

Requirements:

• Understanding English, can you ChatGPT
• 1+ years of experience in a foreign work environment, preferably in accounting or financial administration.
• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
